result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond R. McCarty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
09:42 am - Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf208, 14cf224, 14cf241, 14cf249, 14cf256, 14cm342 and 14tr3266.  In case 14cf208 - State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 1, 3, 4 and 6 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 2 and 5.  In case 14cf224 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 8 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1, 6, 7 and 9.  In case 14cf241 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  In case 14cf249 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  In case 14cf256 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 2 -7 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  State moves to dismiss but read in 14cm342 and 14tr3266 - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.
Court Sentence
14cf208 - Count 2
Impose and Stay - 6 yrs WSP - 3 yrs Initial Confinement, 3 yrs Extended Supervision
Probation 4 yrs
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Restitution - TBD within 30 days
Jail credit 63 days - ONLY
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
All other Counts
WHS/POP 4 yrs
Court Costs/Supervision Fees
Restitution - TBD
Any other conditions/counseling deemed approrpiate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI, WEDS given
Eligible for CIP, Ineligible for SAP

Calling 14tr3058, 14tr3266, 14cf20814cf224, 14cf241, 14cf249, 14cf256 and 14cm342.  Rielly states has submitted a proposal for a global resolution to the State.  In 14cf256 - Rielly request to modify $7500 cash bond.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly. Jodie Bednar Clemens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:31
Calling 14cf208,14cf224 and 14cf241 set for arraignment - and 14cf249,14cf256 for prelim and 14cm342,14tr3266, for status - 
Called 14cf249 prelim first - State calls Kurt Helke/sworn/direct - witness IDs defendant - state request court take Judicial notice of prior bonds - 14cm342,14cf208 14cf224 and 14cf241/Court so notices/Cross by Rielly/
Court finds PC exists on 14cf249 and binds over - -
Proceed with 14cf256 - State calls Sheriff Grady Hartmann/sworn/direct -witness IDs defendant/Cross by Rielly / State request Court take judicial notice of  14CF241, 14cf224, 14cf208, and 14cf249 - Court so notices.   
Court finds probable cause exists and binds over  - State intends to add charge of obstruction on information - Court statement - Court finds probably cause exists and binds over - 
Informations now filed on 14cf208,14cf224,14cf241,14cf249 and 14cf256 - In receipt of all informations - waive readings- not guilty plea entered to all cases - 
Rielly statement to bail-/Bednar Clemens statement - Court statement - Court continues bond as set. 
All files set for 1-20-15
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

10:09 am - Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf208 (PH), 14cf224 (PH), 14cf241 (PH), 14cf249 (AIA), 14cf256 (AIA), 14cm342 (STC) and 14tr3266.  In 14cf208 -  - Rielly motion to sequester all witnesses - Granted.  State calls Oneida County Sheriif's Deputy Chad Wanta/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Rielly.  Rielly statement to finding of probable cause.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial. In 14cf224 - State calls RPD Detective Joshua Chiamulera/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - Bednar submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Bond Form) Marked and Rec'd - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Rielly/Re-Direct by Bednar/Re-Cross by Rielly.  Rielly statement to finding of probable cause.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  In 14cf241 - State calls RPD Detective Joshua Chiamulera/Remains under oath/Direct by Bednar - Submits to Court Exhibits 1 & 2 (Bond forms) Marked and Rec'd/Cross by Rielly.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  In 14cf249 and 14cf256 - Rielly directs defendant to contact PD for representation.  Rielly to obtain complaints from DA's office, waives reading.  Court sets prelim dates for these two cases on December 18, 2014 at 3:30 p.m.  All cases to track with the prelim date.  Arraignment dates on the three prelim cases heard on today's date.  Bail continued.

02:47 pm - Defendant Raymond R. McCarty in court with attorney Michael J. Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf208, 14cf224, 14cm342 and 14cf241 (initial).    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
.  Michlig/Rielly to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact w/D.F., may not be on premises of United Rentals and/or Now Equipment

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.
